subject: Re: [junit] failSame,. etc. will be public?
msgSnippet: ... Too many methods i not convenient. It s just confusing. If nobody actually needs these, then they should be left out. If only a few people need them, they
messageBody:
Alexandru Popescu wrote:

> Assert is an utility class so it tries to offer convinient methods for almost everything. Following
> the above argument all assert(type, type) can be removed and only left assert(String, Object,
> Object), but you will find afterwards ugly to write assert(new Integer(val1), ...).

Too many methods i not convenient. It's just confusing. If nobody
actually needs these, then they should be left out. If only a few people
need them, they should still be left out. And, no, it doesn't at all
follow that we only need to assert String equality. Everything is not a
string and comparing strings for equality is not the same as comparing
integers, doubles, objects, object arrays, and more.


--
ï»¿Elliotte Rusty Harold elharo@...
